info.description:
## TMF API Reference: TMF685 Resource Pool Management   ### Release : 18.0 Resources that can
be reserved are only
in one pool.
IF a resource is not found in a pool is infinite.
When one makes a reservation for a resource, then we check availability of 
this resource on that specific dates
if checkAvailability returns the resource
then it can be reserved on that specific requested date and time.
info.title: Resource Pool Management

post.description: This operation executes task to retrieve available Resource entities or to check resource pool has available Resource capacity.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The Availability Check to be created

post.summary: Creates an 'Extract' action and modifies a pool
post.description: In this operation, TASK is executed to extract the capacity of the resource from the resource pool to another pool.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The Extract to be performed

post.description: Sets the communication endpoint address the service instance must use to deliver information about its health state, execution state, failures and metrics.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Data containing the callback endpoint to deliver the information

delete.description: Resets the communication endpoint address the service instance must use to deliver information about its health state, execution state, failures and metrics.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the registered listener

post.summary: Creates a 'Push' action and modifies a Pool
post.description: This operation runs TASK, which adds the capacity of the new resource to the resource pool.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The Push to be performed

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Comma separated properties to display in response

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Requested number of resources to be provided in response

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Requested index for start of resources to be provided in response

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The Reservation to be created

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Identifier of the Reservation

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The Reservation to be updated

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Identifier of the Reservation

get.description: This operation list or find ResourcePool entities

parameters.description: Comma-separated properties to be provided in response

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Requested number of resources to be provided in response

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Requested index for start of resources to be provided in response

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The Resource Pool to be created

get.description: This operation retrieves a ResourcePool entity. Attribute selection is enabled for all first level attributes.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Comma-separated properties to provide in response

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Identifier of the ResourcePool

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Identifier of the Resource Pool

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The Resource Pool to be updated

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Identifier of the Resource Pool

@baseType.description: When sub-classing, this defines the super-class

@schemaLocation.description: A URI to a JSON-Schema file that defines additional attributes and relationships

dayOfWeek.description: A day or days representing when the schedule is applicable. For example 2, 3 represent Monday and Tuesday.

endDateTime.description: The period of time for which the schedule is applicable.  Instance values are mutually exclusive with daysOfWeek values.

fromDateTime.description: The period of time for which the schedule is applicable.  Instance values are mutually exclusive with daysOfWeek values.

rangeInterval.description: An indicator that specifies the inclusion or exclusion of the from and to DateTime attributes.  Possible values are "open", "closed", "closedBottom" and "closedTop".

ApplicableTimePeriod.title: ApplicableTimePeriod
ApplicableTimePeriod.description: The period of time for which Capacity or CapacityDemand applies.

@baseType.description: When sub-classing, this defines the super-class

appliedDemandAmount.description: An amount of demand applied to a CapacityAmount. Note that this is a composite attribute defined by CapacityAmount.

AppliedCapacityAmount.title: AppliedCapacityAmount
AppliedCapacityAmount.description: The amount of CapcityDemand applied to a CapacityAmount.
